data.title: Cheaper option not worth it
data.text: Booked in 2 nights given corporate travel agent mess up and had to relocated from a nearby Marriott hotel during business trip in the area. Neighbourhood is dull but restaurants are very close. The front desk fellow was nice & efficient. The room doors are all outside and it does feel like a sketchy area. The room is dated, the bed AND pillow uncomfortable, and certainly a cover up smell. Tried to watch some hockey and the tv reception/quality was very poor. I had no major issues to complain upon but decided to end my stay after 1 night and relocate to an very inconveniently name brand newer hotel for the next night. That pretty much says it all. Red Roof charged me for the 2 nights but did put through a 1 night credit within a day so that part was fine.

data.title: Horrific!!!
data.text: This nightmare began at the front desk where Keisha with a T, was rude and confrontational.  It continued in the room where a syringe needle was found under the chair cushion in plain sight.  When I informed the front desk, she asked if I had brought it down!!!!  Then proceeded of question me as if I was making it up.  I taped the entire conversation.  Utterly ridiculous and disgusted with the lack of customer service.

data.title: Great staff
data.text: The staff was great, the beds were super hard. The door had what looked liked blood stain. The floor needed a good scrubbing, not a swiffer. Over-all, I guess it could have been worse. I just wish the beds didn't seem like there were plywood.

data.title: Uninspired if not depressing
data.text: As the saying goes... "You get what you pay for" unless you stay here. I was there for the Ryder Cup. Price gouging was in full effect $175/night versus the published $84. If not for a lack of choices, $50 is more in line with what should be charged. It's the simple stuff like...unknown stain on the wall...clean it off or repaint. No need to rant. You can tell the owner isn't that prideful of the property.

data.title: Water pressure is the BEST!!!!
data.text: Good registration experience, clean room, comfortable bed, air conditioner worked well and no insects. OMG...the water pressure was better than good... The remote didn't work but front desk was quick to reprogram it.  Had issues with the wireless... front desk did not give us the log in and password at check in and it was sketchy.  Stayed there due to the location and would again if I was ever in the area.  We are "green travelers" and do not get our rooms serviced daily...we swap our towels with housekeeping (who was very accommodating).

data.title: Nice Room but we did have issues
data.text:
Our room was very nice. Looks like it has been recently remodeled. Maid service was awful. Came back to our room to find the door left open by the maid. All she did was throw 3 clean towels on one of the beds and did an awful job of making the beds.

Looks like they rent some rooms out on a long term basis. You could tell some people were using their rooms as their permanent homes. Noticed sign in lobby alerting long term guests that they had to check out by September 29th because hotel need the rooms for the Ryder Cup visitors.

data.title: Clean? Not our room
data.text: I admit I probably get fussy as I get older, but this place was really run down. Holes and stains on the bedspread and dirty smudges all other the mirror, the microwave, the fridge. Cigarette butts and toilet paper on the stairway... I really didn't expect this at this location. It might be a good motel for construction workers who are tired enough to sleep anywhere, but I would not stay here again.

data.title: Very Unique......Smelling!!!
data.text: During my three-day stay I was haunted by the smell of Pine-Sol and cigarette smoke emanating from unknown areas of my hotel room.  The free Wi-Fi was 100% crap.   I do not believe that this hotel has any smoke-free rooms so if you are sensitive to smoke I would not go to this hotel.  The hotel does not offer bfast.

data.title: Supposedly 2 nights stay in Minneapolis
data.text:
Arrived the hotel after a drive of close to 6 hours and was really tired. Checked in. Superb guy at the reception. We exceptionally nice. 

Then we got to the room which was nice. But right outside...there were people urging and the police were called. I felt very uncomfortable and Seidel to stay at another hotel the next day.

Basically I was not comfortable with the surroundings.

data.title: Clean and affordable
data.text: We booked on the last minute and they were very accommodating and helpful in getting us a handicap room on the first floor. Our room was not ready at check in, however, but we were happy with how clean it was. The quickly replaced the faulty fridge and it met our needs for a short stay.

data.title: Unclean
data.text: I found a bug on my bed upon entering. Then after taking off my shoes to a sticky floor I found Applebee's from the previous guest in the refrigerator. The shower was not cleaned. I am not a picky guest but this was the worst experience I have ever had at any hotel.

data.title: Functional
data.text: We travel with dogs so appreciate finding a place like this where dogs are accommodated for free. There are trade-offs, however. The mattress on the bed was very hard-- and I am someone who tent-camps, so I am not the princess from "The Princess and the Pea." There were burn holes in the bed quilt, and we are non-smokers so this was a tad disturbing. But most of all, there was no wi-fi, when the ad for the Inn indicated there was free wi-fi. My computer found several options under the name Red Roof Inn, but all were one bar and I couldn't get online. Frankly, I'd rather pay more money for a place that is cleaner and more comfortable, has internet and maybe also has a hot breakfast.

data.title: Red Roof stay
data.text: No hot water for shower in the morning.  Told front desk and was told others had complained and maintenance was on the way, but I had to go. Would like a discount or credit for future visit. Otherwise stay was fine.

owner_response.author: RedRoofInnPlymouth, General Manager at Red Roof Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear terri9208,

Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at the Plymouth Red Roof. I am sorry that your experience did not meet your expectations. Please accept our sincerest apologies for the hot water troubles. We had trouble with our water heaters over the weekend, and despite the multiple plumbers/technicians that came in to fix it, the problem persisted. 

If you would please contact me at redroof202@gmail.com or respond to my message to you on TripAdvisor, I would be happy to see what I can do to make up for the issue.
 
I can assure you that corrective measures will be taken to ensure a similar situation does not occur in the future. At Red Roof, it is our intention to have your confidence in our abilities to prevent similar problems in the future. Please know that we value you as our guest and appreciate your business. Thank you for sharing your concerns and I hope you will give us the opportunity to better serve you at Red Roof the next time your travel plans require lodging. 

Very truly yours,
Saad Ahmad
General Manager

Red Roof Inn - Plymouth
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Convenient
data.text: I visited the area on business recently with my family and had a good time. Would visit again. The flat screen TVs and convenient restaurants are a bonus. The lobby is very modern and clean and the staff is helpful with any needs or directions.

owner_response.author: RedRoofInnPlymouth, General Manager at Red Roof Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Richard R,

I appreciate your comments regarding your recent stay at the Plymouth Red Roof. We always enjoy hearing about the positive experiences our guests have at our hotels.  

I will make sure to share your comments with the rest of our team.  Positive guest feedback, like yours, is always an encouragement to all of our staff as we strive to continuously improve the quality of our services. 

Thank you again for sharing your experience, I hope your next visit will be as pleasant as the previous one.

Sincerely,
Saad Ahmad
General Manager
Red Roof Inn - Plymouth
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Stayed on business
data.text: With the speed of checkin, fresh coffee whenever you need, and the laundry facility, someone traveling on business couldn't ask for more.  It also very close to downtown, and by 494 that takes you to MOA and the airport.  Very convenient, and for someone who doesn't have time for certain ammenities, but still has to pay for them at other hotels, this Inn has the right price and just what I need.

owner_response.author: RedRoofInnPlymouth, General Manager at Red Roof Inn Minneapolis Plymouth, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Judy,

I appreciate your comments regarding your recent stay at the Plymouth Red Roof. We always enjoy hearing about the positive experiences our guests have at our hotels.  

I will make sure to share your comments with the rest of our team.  Positive guest feedback, like yours, is always an encouragement to all of our staff as we strive to continuously improve the quality of our services. 

Thank you again for sharing your experience, I hope your next visit will be as pleasant as the previous one.

Sincerely,
Saad Ahmad

Red Roof Inn - Plymouth
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Free wifi, and pet friendly with no pet fee!
data.text: We loved the convenient location, with a restaurant next door.  The staff was so nice, and the superior king was perfect!  With the hotel having exterior doors, it made it so nice to just pull up and go to your room.

data.title: Poorly maintained rooms in Plymouth Minnesota
data.text:
12/31/2015 - Non smoking room smelled of smoke.  Requested another and moved.  In that room the toilet leaked and puddled on the floor. Requested another and moved.  In that room the sink was plugged up, filter on heater inlet was clogged with grime preventing air flow to heat the room.  Cleaned it myself.  When door was closed cold air came in around sides and across bottom.  They charge $1.61 to use the safe but didn't see the notice in the very small print on the contract.

If this location is corporate owned, then the lack of proper management and maintenance is giving Red Roof a bad reputation.  If this location is franchise owned then they do not put any money back into the business.  Simple things like making sure TV remotes have batteries, Drano or something is used in the sinks to prevent clogging, air intake filters on electric heaters are cleaned or replaced and doors are properly sealed to prevent cold December air from coming in.

We will never use Red Roof again and will go elseware for a little extra charge but acceptable comfort.

data.title: Fourth Stay, and getting better
data.text:
GELiLa  at the front desk was an absolute dream.
My fourth visit here.  Better than usual Red Roof Beds. 
All room have micro/fridge.  
Plenty of plugs for charging.
Flat screen tv.  Everything works.  Safe in room.
Great Budget Motel.
Excellent Broadway pizza and bar next door.  Super pizza.
Business area.

data.title: Glad I gave it a 2nd Chance
data.text: I come to the area to visit my immediate family during the holidays and stayed at this location little over a year ago. Lets say my experience was less than satisfactory. Coming back to area and staying at RedRoof i thought i would give them a second chance and glad i did. The hotel seems to be under management and in shows. The rooms have been updated and look great! I wouldn't let old prior negative reviews effect your judgement. Overall I've had a great stay and definitely will be back to stay with them again!

data.title: Excellent and quality service with an very economical rate
data.text: This was a great experience to stay at Red Roof inn.  The room was equipped with all basic needs, great helping and trustworthy staffs.  The motel is located in very safe and secure location surrounded by restaurants businesses and shopping centers.  Icing on the all these come with a very econimical motel rate.  Great experoence!!!
